climbs.name: Sundowner
climbs.fa: Rusty Baillie et al. (per The Granite Dells Climbing Guide by Kevin Keith)

content.description: Climb: Chunky, low angle start leads to a somewhat exposed slab section. Traverse to the right of a diagonal bulge then surmount a large horizontal flake about 3/4 of the way up the wall. Above it, find a 2-bolt belay station. Second pitch is about 25 feet of easy climbing to a 2-bolt anchor. Can comfortably be done as one pitch with a 70m rope. 60m might work, but make sure the free end of the rope is secured. Descent: top anchor bolts may be too small to accommodate safety tether while rigging for rappel, so be careful. Also: the ledge at the first belay makes rope-pulling tricky. Either rap in two pitches; or walk all the way off to the north and scramble down to the ground; or walk north along the broad summit to one of the nearby rap stations for Granite Alley or Alpenglow (may need 70m rope for these).
content.protection: 6 bolts on the first pitch, 2 on the second. Bolted anchors. No quicklinks.
content.location: Starts just right of large, dark crack on Alpenglow Wall.

content.description: This is the obvious crack climb, immediately right of Alpenglow.  Surprisingly good climbing, and worth doing!  Climb the crack, and belay when the climbing eases up considerably.  You can also walk further back, and find a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Immediately right of Alpenglow and left of Sundowner (the bolted route to the right).

climbs.name: Belt of Venus
climbs.fa: John Sasso and Aaron Vix, April 1st 2017

content.description: Bolted route to the left of Alpenglow up a small gully about 50' or so.
Climb a meandering slab past 10 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Just left of the large crack on the Alpenglow Wall

content.description: This area is west facing on the large formation behind the Main Wall, and in the Central Gulley South. The routes here require a 70 meter rope for a rappel or just walk off.
